title: Not a Viktor player but please nerf the right thing
body:
His base damage and AP scaling are fine, that's not what is causing the problem. The problem is infact his mana scaling on his shield that needs looked at for the build he's going. It's just making him way too tanky with {{item:3025}} {{item:3001}} 

I use to love playing Viktor but it's been ages since I played him because I personally prefered him pre-rework, but I still don't want to see him destroyed because of top Viktor being overbearing. Just nerf the correct thing and leave AP Viktor alone.

replies.body: no, the base damage is definitely part of the issue, lol. The fact that he can run two tank items alongside his Perfect Core and maintain 100-0 pressure on squishies is absurd.
So why is he not crowding out mid lane with his base damages? The issue is far more complicated than 'he does too much damage'.

Apples and oranges.

Yeah which is what causes the build to work top and not be that great mid, it's not just 'too much damage' there's a whole host of reasons the build works.

Btw yes I'm a Viktor main and I even hate the build, I don't play it either and I do want it nerfed.

> Yeah which is what causes the build to work top and not be that great mid, it's not just 'too much damage' 

It's exactly that, though. You can sit on his face with a bruiser/tank, and he out-point-and-clicks you.

On mid it's different because mid champions either have huge range, or huge burst and mobility, so they have no reason to eat this AA-spam.

But the core issue is retarded damage.

Yeah, so buff up the other toplaners and he won't be such a menace and at the same time we've preserved a playstyle that some players find fun?

I've said this time and time again, he's only good because he counters {{champion:266}} and {{champion:6}} who have literally seen near 100% pick ban rate.

Because the base damages on his Q doesn't really impact midlanes primarily ranged roster, and midlane Viktor doesn't max cdr nearly as quickly. So midlane Viktor loses 0-20 damage on his empowered auto starting at level 9; while toplane viktor loses 5-20 damage starting at level 4 when those small numbers are much more relevant.

I think the Q nerfs are pretty good. 

Ult nerfs are a bit heavy though. I understand why they are there since divers are going to have a much harder time escaping it early, so level 6 is actually a power spike for top Vik. However it's also going to hurt midlane Viktor when divers go mid.

Actually, for once they do nerf the right thing.
The issue is not that he gets tanky from building tanky, that's totally fine.
The issue is that he can do so and still stay a major damagethreat with decent waveclear and CC.

Nerfing base damage and buffing ratio is the best way at dealing with him without hurting AP-Vik to much.
The tuneing might need a bit work, Q nerf seems spot on but ult might hit ap-vic to heavily aswell, but the general direction of forceing him into building damage if he wants to do high damage is fine.
Maybe his core could use some change, less AP, more utillity, like 10-20%cdr which would help AP vic by freeing up his builtpath and tank vic would overcap cdr with his usuall built while getting less AP.
Another issue is Iceborn on ranged, Ez players might hate me, but it's about time to make it melee only or atleast change some values for rangeds.

You could have Iceborn only apply a slow to the primary target for ranged champs, for instance.

Also, Iceborn on Ezreal is actually a trap item for most of the players: 
https://lolalytics.com/ranked/worldwide/platinum/plus/champion/Ezreal/ADC/

Nerf attack range!

If Vlad and Morg can be stable picks in whatever roles they're in, despite their basic attack range, then so can Viktor!

The problem is that he can safely and consistently proc Kleptomancy with 550 attack range. Which is the same range that many mages and marksman have. But because of the slow from Iceborn Gauntlet and the speed boost from his Q make it impossible to catch up and trade blows with him.

With a lowered attack range, Viktor can be more prone to harass and gap closers, meaning CC and burst can be more punish if he decides to proc Klepto, and melee champions have a bigger window of opportunity to strike back.
Ranged champions shouldn't have full auto attack resets because they heavily skew early fights, Viktor can use his q to do this. If anything should be changed then it should be his aa reset.
